title: Complementary and Alternative Medicine
author: Louis Calder Memorial Library; University
cleaned_text: Table of Contents Welcome to the Complementary and Alternative Medicine (CAM) Guide The goals of this guide are to: - to offer a list of authoritative online and library resources on the topic of CAM. - to assist in evaluating the effectiveness of various CAM treatments. - to understand the differences between complimentary medicine, alternative medicine, and integrative medicine. Related Guides Librarians Jorge E. Perez - Instructional and Information Services Librarian [jep4244@med.miami.edu](mailto:jep4244@med.miami.edu) - (305) 243-5439 - Contact Us Department of Learning, Research, and Clinical Information Services - Email: [reference@miami.edu](mailto:reference@miami.edu) - Phone: 305-243-6648 Subscription Databases [CINAHL Plus](http://access.library.miami.edu/login?url=https://search.ebscohost.com/login.aspx?authtype=ip,uid&profile=ehost&defaultdb=jlh) Primary index to the international literature of nursing and health. CINAHL Plus provides a wide scope of nursing and allied health journals as well as a high number of records, full-text, and cited references. In addition, it provides full-text evidence-based care sheets, quick lessons and continuing education modules. [Cochrane Library](http://access.library.miami.edu/login?url=https://www.cochranelibrary.com/) Collection of health databases providing independent evidence to inform clinical treatment decisions and other health related decisions. Includes: Cochrane Database of Systematic Reviews, Cochrane Controlled Trials Register, Database of Abstracts of Reviews of Effects, Cochrane Methodology Register, Health Technology Assessment Database and NHS Economic Evaluation Database. [Embase](http://access.library.miami.edu/login?url=http://www.embase.com/) EMBASE, from Elsevier Life Sciences Solutions, provides extensive coverage of international biomedical journals and conferences and is a key resource for generating systematic reviews, making informed decisions in evidence-based medicine, and for post-market surveillance of drugs and medical devices. [Micromedex](http://access.library.miami.edu/login?url=http://access.library.miami.edu/login?url=https://www.micromedexsolutions.com/micromedex2/librarian) MICROMEDEX is a collection of many different drug databases, Martindale, the Physician's Desk Reference databases. [Natural Medicines](http://access.library.miami.edu/login?url=https://naturalmedicines.therapeuticresearch.com/) Natural Medicines provides unbiased, evidence-based information and ratings on over 90,000 dietary supplements, natural medicines, and complementary and alternative therapies. [PubMed](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/?otool=flumrlib) Database produced by NLM (National Library of Medicine) containing bibliographic references, including abstracts of articles from thousands of bio medical journals.
